Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan D
Reviews.Content: Clean, friendly, beautiful, and a great value!! Room was very nice and service was excellent. Beautiful, classical furniture, private balcony, bathroom, etc. everything was just perfect. Breakfast was great, cereals, toast, eggs, sausages, good coffee, all in a cozy sunroom filled with art. Perfect morning to start the day and has a great location with lots of walks to nearby shopping and dining centres. The staff was very friendly and helped us get acquainted with the area. Great hotel and I will recommend it to all my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “like staying in a friend's home”
Reviews.Author: babyboomercanberra
Reviews.Content: the hughenden is my favourite place to stay in sydney.great loaction near oxford st, close to all transport to the beach or the city. it is a renovated old mansion which is a little faded in places but full of character. the breakfast was fantastic!-it is advisable to ask for a room out the back...

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but average service and small rooms”
Reviews.Author: RocketAus
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here (Feb 2012) for 5 nights whilst in Sydney for business. The room was booked for me and after reading reviews here I rang up well in advance to request a quiet room with aircon. Upon arrival I was checked in by a young man. He handed my my key and said nothing. I had to ask where my room was and was not told anything about the place including the included breakfast - which I discovered on my second last day. The room I was initially given was near reception, next to a stairwell and opposite the breakfast area - clearly NOT a quiet room. When I went back to reception another man abruptly told me that they were very full. He also advised me in a condescending tone that I had been upgraded, almost implying that I should be grateful for the room. I explained that I would prefer a quieter room and that I had requested one. He then gave me a key to another room. Room 26 was up a flight of stairs accessed off a back porch. Not so secure, but that didn't bother me. There is a sign on the door accessing the landing to keep the door locked at night for security - and my room was on the outside. The room was clean and comfortable, but tiny. As a business traveller staying for 5 nights, I'd assume I'd at least have a desk for a computer or do work plus a wardrobe. Unfortunately no to either. There was a chest of draws I could put my laptop on and had to sit sideways to work. All my business suits and shirts were hung over hooks with a couple of hangers provided. The bathroom was compact, but clean. A tiny shelf above the sink had a box of tissues and nice amenities. No room to put my toiletries, so had then on a side table in the bedroom. Every morning when I showered, the temperature would fluctuate dramatically and without notice (obviously depending on other occupants) from freezing cold to boiling hot. The buffet breakfast was limited but adequate. I wish when I checked in they told me about it. My colleague, who booked the room for me, rang up at one stage to complain about the room. He had been shown and selected another room for me that had a wardrobe and desk. The manager advised him that this room was under renovation or something. I also got a note that night when I returned explaining something similar and asking me to contact the manager about the matter as they were not full. clearly this was different to what I had been told at check-in. As a regular business traveller to Sydney, I can put this down as another experience and will never go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “simply fabulous”
Reviews.Author: john j
Reviews.Content: It is simply fabulous. You are 3 kms from Sydney city, a nice walk, you can see the centrepoint tower from Oxford Street, just around the corner. The room we had was a balcony room, right at the front. What a surprise when you walk in. Its decorated like an old English manor. There is a fridge and microwave, if you want to keep a few knibbles handy. The breakfast is lovely, and the meals in the restaurant, first class. Never tasted a better or more tender steak ever. We went through Travelzoo. If you arent a member you should be. The discount was phenomenol. Even without the discount, the place is wonderful. For being so close to the city, you cant ask for more. The shopping down Oxford Street is amazing. The second hand shops were great, and if you want a great meal for a great price, go to the Paddington Hotel on Tuesdays. They have buy one meal, get one free. We thought they handnt charged us enough, but its one meal free. You have to try the Hughendon, beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “characterful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: canarysop
Reviews.Content: This is lovely characterful place to stay, an ideal antidote to chain hotels. I felt very much at home in the pleasantly rambling Victorian character of the building and the interesting things on the walls. Also liked the garden courtyard, a peaceful place to sit. It's in a great location - lots of buses into the city and also to Bondi and Bronte beaches. Queen St is a delightful neighbourhood with one-off shops and cafes,and there are also takeaways and a decent Thai restaurant in Oxford St. Breakfast was good, different each day, and always included something hot as well as standard continental items. In the first room it was accompanied by ghastly musak though..... not so audible from the conservatory, fortunately. And on this same subject, the live 'music' on Thursday evening was so awful that we couldn't even face having a drink in the bar. That's a pity, as everything else was good, and I would certainly stay there again. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: naej
Reviews.Content: I bought a couple of nights accommodation at this hotel through travelzoo, was truly amazed by the value of this deal which included dinner bed and breakfast. All very nice. Almost like a museum it was all tastefully arranged and very interesting. Plenty of buses passing the hotel into the city centre. Will return if I ever see the same deal again.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing/”
Reviews.Author: njh2104
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hughenden in November 2012. We chose this hotel based on the information and photos on The Hughendenâ€™s website and also its location in Woollahra. We were extremely disappointed in our room having booked a Queen Victorian room however it looked much smaller that the one pictured on the website and looked more like the 'cosy' room. The room was in need of repair, updating and cleaning and the ensuite bathroom was very small and grotty in places. We also booked and paid for a car park and, where we had to park it, hoped we would not come out the next morning to find a dint in it. Needless to say we wonâ€™t be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Things are looking up at our favourite hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Greg C
Reviews.Content: After writing a quite harsh review in November last year we were heartened to see that the new manager had taken the time to respond to our review. At last someone was listening! So, we decided to give the Hughenden one more chance... And we are SO pleased we did. The rooms are still small, the parking is still limited but readily available by reserving when you book, and the hotel is still in need of sprucing up (though the rooms are gradually being upgraded and modernised). Now, however, the hotel seems to be returning to what it does best: being a warm, welcoming home-away-from-home; offering friendly, smiling service; providing well cooked breakfasts and vastly improved dinners;having staff who seem to be enjoying their work. It's clear that the appointment of a long term staff member to the position of General Manager has turned the Hughenden around. Keep up the good work, Lisa.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Sambalbelachan
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hughendon several times over the past 8 years. Was a friendly and warm hotel when run by (I think) one of the sisters who own the hotel. With a new manager when I was there in Oct 2011 it's now far from how it was. I found it disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great romantic weekend away!”
Reviews.Author: Sammuel_H
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend spent our weekend away at The Hughenden to celebrate our 1 year anniversary and what a great weekend away it was! Firstly the service was exceptional, the reservations team welcomes you like a close friend you have known for years. We stayed in a King Deluxe suite to celebrate the occasion, it looked like the bathroom had been recently been refurbished as it was very modern and fresh looking. The bathroom also had a bath which was very nice after a long day exploring the city (we spent the day in Manly, a quick bus ride to circular quay and then a scenic ferry trip across the harbour). We had dinner in the Hughenden CafÃ© both nights of our trip, I had the Lamb Shank Pot pie as recommended by the waitress the first night and then the Beef tenderloin the 2nd night â€“ so succulent! My girlfriend had the market fresh fish and the Kangaroo fillet the 2nd night, we were both very happy with our meals! Not to mention dessert, we shared a soufflÃ© which took about 20 minutes (as told by our waitress) however it was well worth the wait! Breakfast each morning was really generous, a selection of fresh fruits, muesli, yoghurt, spreads, toast and not to mention the weekend breakfast menu, I ordered pancakes and my girlfriend ordered eggs benedict on our last morning. The hallways throughout the hotel are filled up with history and information which you could read for hours! My favourite was the section about cricket, my grandad would love it! In summary, a really cosy and friendly stay which reminds you of those sweet cottages up in the mountains however you are practically in the CBD! I highly recommend everyone spend a weekend at the Hughenden or even try and pop in to the restaurant. 11/10!!!

Reviews.Title: “EVERYTHING EXCEPT THE PARKING”
Reviews.Author: GKSWanderlust
Reviews.Content: I think the general tenor of all the reviews on tripadvisor pretty much hit the mark. We booked two rooms for just one night. I had last stayed at this hotel in 2003 and it was good then and still is in terms of friendly and good service, adequate and interesting guest rooms, great public areas (you could spend hours "reading the walls") and very satisfactory breakfast and dining service, all at a good price. Our friends from Brisbane arrived very early due to unexpected transport changes, and were delighted with the efforts made to cater to their needs until a room was ready late morning. We were upgraded from a Victoria room to a family suite on the first floor. The room was on the upstairs south western corner of the hotel (18) and although very satisfactory was a bit noisier than we are used to, due to proximity to a busy intersection. Next time we will ask for something a bit more remote from the traffic. Our friends were downstairs towards the rear of the hotel and slept in total silence. The parking (or lack of) was something that caused concern. Immediately after making the reservation, I did receive a call from the hotel telling me all of their limited spots were booked but I was on "a waiting list". On the morning prior to our arrival I enquired and was told I was "number 1 on the waiting list". On arrival there was no parking and initially I had trouble finding a "2 Hour" spot within cooee of the hotel. At checkin one of the most helpfull staff advised she was going off duty in a couple of hours, was parked in an unrestricted spot (very rare in this area) and offered to hold it for me when she left. This meant some inconvenience waiting for her spot to become available, but we filled in the time over lunch in the restaurant. I couldn't fault the caring and helpfull attitudes of the staff but just be warned that it may be an issue if you intend staying at this hotel with a car. I did find it strange and somewhat surprising to observe from our room, which overlooked the carpark, that 4 or more spots remained vacant all that night. Obviously the "wait list" system has some deficiencies. However, I'll be back, access to the SCG is excellent. I'll just make sure I book really well in advance and ensure I have guaranteed parking before I confirm.

Reviews.Title: “totally charming”
Reviews.Author: VivienneSydney
Reviews.Content: we booked into the Hughenden, as it was close to a wedding that we were lucky enough to attend. we were impressed by the location (very close to Oxford Street & Centennial Park) & the ease of being able to park on the property. hearing piano music as we checked in, and wandering through the rambling corridors to find our room which was right at the back - we loved the authentic atmosphere. we were once again pleasantly surprised by our room, which was compact but had everything we needed including a small indoor / outdoor area where we could sit outside and read / watch the world go by, over the car park: yes - but we still had a good view of the street. great that they accept pets including kangaroos it seems, I'd love to return and bring my canine companion one day. we liked that this hotel has a character of it's own, and isn't a generic hotel. breakfast was tasty and sufficient, all the staff were pleasant and cheerful. staying at the Hughenden was part of a wonderful Sydney experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Not flashy, but had a great stay, with great food”
Reviews.Author: John-Nesbitt
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the week-end and found the hotel a bit ragged, but clean. Room was nothing special, but everything worked fine. The quirkiness of the hotel is appealing, with old posters, library, lots of daily newspapers, lounge and very helpful staff. Breakfast was very healthy and kept us going all day. We had a meal one evening - small menu, but great food and well priced too. Ordered a plate of hot chips, which was enormous. All other tables then followed our lead. 100m from Centennial Park, heaps of buses at the corner to the City / Bondi & lots of local shops in Paddington / Woollahra. All-in-all a decent place to stay,

Reviews.Title: “Tired and tatty”
Reviews.Author: LittleBurrans
Reviews.Content: An accommodation shortage in the CBD saw me try The Hughenden after a 13 year absence. She is looking tired and tatty, with rooms lacking any character. The traffic noise kept us awake at might and we suspected the bed had either fleas or bugs. Try the bed and breakfast next dor instead.

Reviews.Title: “Unmemorable and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: gigiandme
Reviews.Content: My mother and I had organised a first ever weekend away together in Sydney. We booked about 3 months prior to arrival, thinking that the Hughenden looked quite lovely online. On arrival we were so disappointed to discover our room around the side of the hotel with the front door of our room facing onto the the hotel carpark.....needless to say we were shattered. We asked if we could change rooms, however the hotel was booked out. We tried countless other hotels in the area to no avail. We were stuck. Woollhara is a beautiful part of Sydney, but this hotel we will NEVER re-visit. Tiled floor with a rug, crack in basin, tiny, tiny bathroom, very substandard closet space. Regional motel rooms in the middle of the countryside have more to offer than this.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, old”
Reviews.Author: JupiterAnn53
Reviews.Content: hotel that has been "remodeled" from many incarnations into a boutique hotel. We booked a Victorian Queen and it was sooo small we couldn't stay in it. We were traveling from the States and had 4 pieces of luggage and there wasn't even a closet in the room. They were very gracious and found us another room for our next night and upon return for our final 3 days they put us across the street in another building they have purchased. It was much larger with a kitchen and seperate sitting room, but right on the corner of Oxford and Queen so was very noisey and being on the first floor we couldn't open the blinds because the bedroom was by the sidewalk. This is a victorian residence with stables made into a hotel. The lovely sitting room off the main lobby serves a wonderful and delicious breakfast included each morning. It is very conveniently located to Queen Street/Oxford shopping with nice little pubs around. When booking, the best thing to do is contact them to discuss your space needs.

Reviews.Title: “Out-of-the-way but charming”
Reviews.Author: Nicolle Z
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel in the heart of the tourist district of Sydney, this isn't the place for you. However, once you understand the bus and train system, you learn that this is a nice hotel in an interesting location with a very friendly staff. I was within walking distance of the famous Paddington Markets, as well as many stores and restaurants. Centennial Park is also across the road. The 380 and 333 buses run right past the hotel, from Circular Quay to Bondi Beach, so the location is very convenient to catch a bus and see lots of site. My room was quite nice - in fact, I was given two adjoining rooms at no additional cost. I also took advantage of their special, in which the fourth night's stay was only $1. On average, then, you couldn't beat the price. I was disappointed by the size of the bathroom - very small, hard to use the sink, hard to turn around, and no place to put the toiletries. Additionally, it looks like there is mold on the ceiling. I also found the room very musty smelling, even with the patio doors open and the ceiling fan on. The armoir and the dresser also smell very very old. I did not realize that this was a pet-friendly hotel, so I was annoyed by the constant barking next door. The staff were *excellent*! They were all extremely friendly and accommodating (except when I commented on the mustiness of the room). The breakfasts were also tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you want to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Rebekah G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to the designer clothing boutiques of Oxford Street. It advertises itself as Boutique with recently refurbished modern and minimalist terrace suites. The suggested view across Centenial park wasn't evident from the ground floor of number 5 plus the fact that the courtyard garden was so overgrown you couldnt access it let alone derive any pleasure from sitting in it.You had to squeeze past a parked car or enter through someone elses front patch (my key opened that too) The main problem is the place is falling down old with a very cosmetic slap of paint on it and cheap everything else to boot. The people above you are the main problem with every chair scrape , foot fall, nose blow and what ever else they are doing completely audible with no effort being made at soundproofing. Over all impossible to sleep until upstairs has gone to bed and isn't that what we are paying for... a bed. I checked out at 7am when the people upstairs woke me and passed my time in a coffee shop until I started work at 9am. Management couldn't have cared less when I mentioned the noise. AVOID

Reviews.Title: “tried and true”
Reviews.Author: ancientone001
Reviews.Content: I flew from New Zealand for my daughter's wedding in August again again stayed at this hotel. I was delighted fo find the same wonderful service and friendliness I had encountered on previous occasions. I had a "cosy" room which I had requested, it was certainly only suitable for one person byut was on the ground floor which I had asked for. The breakfast was great with plenty to choose from and the restaurant was a perfect place to entertain my family when they visited. I hope to stay again next time I am in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely charm would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Meripino
Reviews.Content: This is a charming hotel, conveniently located in one of Sydney's better areas. Staff are all friendly and helpful, service with a smile, no rolling of eyes. Very good breakfast with plenty of fresh produce. The hotel restaurant is also quite good and reasonably priced. The only negatives are that the bathrooms are not well appointed (not much room to put your toiletries) and bedrooms don't quite match up to website. Other than that the whole experience was a positive one and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Plenty of Character, rooms a little small”
Reviews.Author: starswine
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Queen Victorian room, the room was pretty small - certainly not 'spacious' as advertised but it did contain a very comfortable queen bed and a tiny en-suite (toilet, sink and shower). The size of the room made it pretty difficult to get ready for the function we were attending - when the iron board was used, one of us had to climb over the bed to get to the bathroom. That said, just outside the room was a private (but not secure) atrium/conservatory containing a table and a sofa which was comfortable, perfect for a drink on a summer's evening, perhaps not so in the winter as it lacked heating. Breakfast: average and unexciting â€“ buffet of fruit, muesli from a box, scrambled egg, mushrooms and a selection of sliced bread. Internet: Free wireless internet but this did not work in our room (too far away?) and was intermittent in the breakfast room. Sleep quality: very good â€“ quiet and very comfortable bed. Location: great for Bondi and Paddington and itâ€™s very easy to get into the city by bus or taxi. Cost: $178 inc breakfast for 2 Value : despite the small room, the price is pretty good value for the area Overall: The hotel itself is quite lovely, full of character and charm but that also reads as 'old' and 'perhaps small rooms should have a double instead of a queen bed'.

Reviews.Title: “This place is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: WebaWeka
Reviews.Content: Well, I quickly got out of Regis on Castlereagh. Only took two days and moved into the Hughenden (cnr of Oxford and Queen in Woollahra). The staff are fantastic and the room was large and wait for it... CLEAN. Nothing scary in the bed or in the shower room. PLAIN AND SIMPLE - Clean! It only cost a few bucks more. Okay, it doesn't have a kitchenette, but the other place didn't have a working one, so it has been a tick in every box. M40 is close by, easy to get to and from the city. The piano playing on Thursday and Fridays is simply wonderful along with the service and the meals. Really love this place, so much so I have moved into a permanent place just around the corner!

Reviews.Title: “Disapointing”
Reviews.Author: Gas000
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms one for our children & the "Terrace Room" for my wife & I. The Terrace Room on first inspection was nice. However BEWARE DO NOT BOOK THIS ROOM. On top of the roof there is situated the main commercial kitchen exraction fan unit, along with an aircon compressor all situated next to the skylight above the bed. The noise and vibrations were unbearable and at 2.30am given that I had a 10 hour drive to start that morning a sleeping pill was required. The night staff feigned concern but did nothing to stop the noise. Also on arrival the booking had not been made as per the rates that were given me over the phone. Thankfully Mark on reception was very helpful and honoured their past employees stuff up. However 1 night with dinner for 4 with the reduced rate still came to about $500.00! The dinner was nice but very expensive. I can't reccomend this hotel if you like sleeping. A shame as overall it did have some very nice aspects.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, disappointing for the price”
Reviews.Author: carlsb82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hughenden as we went to watch the Swans at the SCG, so location was convenient. Overall we were disappointed with our stay and not sure how this placed earned it's 4 star rating. We stayed in a terrace which we were told was an upgrade as they had overbooked the hotel.... Made us wonder what we would have got without the upgrade! Hallway was horrifically smelly (like the carpet was damp) and the decor of our room was old and mismatched and felt like someone had just thrown it together without a thought... The breakfast was ok, nothing special, thought they may have made an effort in a competitive area, our advice would be to stroll down Oxford st and find an alternative brekky. For the price, there are plenty of other options (including staying in the city and paying for a cab to and from the footy... Would be similar price). We won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Check everything before staying and get everything in writing..”
Reviews.Author: Meljas69
Reviews.Content: Did a family trip to Sydney with my mum, and we travelled with our dogs. I made sure to book the dog friendly twin accommodation and had that confirmed in several emails and phone calls. When we arrived my mum, who is partly disabled, had been put in an upstairs room that was not dog friendly and had a sunken bath that she would not have been able to use. The room that I had booked had been given to someone else. After much pushing I got a room where I had to look after the 2 dogs whilst my mum was put in another room around the corner. They wanted to charge extra for mum's new room but I had copies of the original booking email and costs and would not budge from that. Rooms were ok, but very basic. We also booked parking for 2 nights but when I rang to confirm the parking I was told that we could only park there 1 night as a marquee was being set up in the car park. I couldn't get in there on the first night as a big van took up 2 spots-including mine. Staff did try to accommodate us but the basic mistakes should not have been made in the first place in a professional hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: megpowis
Reviews.Content: The hotel reminded me of an English country hotel. The rooms were a little tired but clean and well presented. We stayed in the capacious family room but our friends were not too pleased with one of the more cosy rooms. I would therefore recommend the larger rooms. The bathroom was very small and there was no exhaust fan (just a window) but it was very nicely decorated. The staff were friendly, helpful and polite and the breakfast was excellent. It is also pet friendly, not to mention very handy for Paddington, Woolahra and the SCG/SFS.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: petacol
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere for a hotel. Friendly staff, excellent cooked breakfast. Rooms can also accommodate 3 people which is rare and a good price. Rooms are clean and a good size. Daily cleaning service is included and a nice change to other hotels. Modern convenience in classic surroundings. Off-street car parking is also available which is great at $10 a night!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Tigga1
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my 18yro daughter and 22yro son, who was competing at a local sailing event. Even though we could'nt stay in the same room throughout our stay, and therefore was inconvenienced the Hotel made our transition as easy as possible with porters taking our bags etc. The Hotel is oldish with some damp problems however our stay there was wonderful just the same. The staff at the reception desk were friendly and always helpful, the restaurant staff were exceptional, nothing was too much trouble for them, even when the Chef didn't agree!! Even the cleaner was friendly and the handyman fixed our leaking shower promptly and efficiently. We would stay there again, and special mention to the recommended Thair restaurant at Paddington - Well done Hughenden - keep it up!!

Reviews.Title: “needs serious TLC - tired, tatty and generally a bit down at heel”
Reviews.Author: badddriva
Reviews.Content: It must have been lovely once! The bar and restaurant area are charming and it's a great location, if a little noisy. But the rooms are shockingly basic and quite tatty. Service varied from front of house which was generally good to breakfast which depended on the person you got, and crockery could be stained and often chipped.

Reviews.Title: “Dingy and depressing”
Reviews.Author: Theo_9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fabulous location, but that is the only good thing about it. The hotel is dusty and depressing. The breakfast is so bad that after the first day we went out for breakfast. They didn't inform us in advance about a $20 charge for parking. We were there over a week-end and could have parked on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, more interesting than a hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: magicpossum
Reviews.Content: We were in Sydney for the opera, and enjoyed the 5km walk to the Opera House, though could easily have caught a bus. The hotel is a big old rambling place with lots of interesting art and furniture - much more inviting than most hotels. The room was pleasantly furnished with old and antique furniture (but nice firm, comfortable bed!). The ensuite was small but had everything we needed. The only thing lacking was reading lights over the bed. The Hughenden is just off busy Oxford Street in a lovely leafy area of Sydney. Our room overlooked Queen Street, and we were a bit worried it might be noisy on a Saturday night - but this was not the case at all, even though we had the window onto the street open. Staff were friendly and helpful. A decent breakfast included in the tariff (although only dripolator coffee included - an excellent espresso can be purchased for $3.50)

Reviews.Title: “We stayed in the apartments - lovely but LOUD traffic”
Reviews.Author: VanBC_girl
Reviews.Content: I have read the reviews about the rooms at the Hughenden, and we didn't experience anything old or run down, as we stayed (my boyfriend and I) last weeked in the terrace apartments across the street that they have as well. I really liked them - we had a queen bed, air cond, small fridge, microwave, etc - not really a kitchenette but enough. Bathroom very clean, and we had a terrace which we never sat on for the main reason I am getting to that prevents me from giving this place a rave review. Oxford Street, while extremely central and convenient, is SUPER loud at this intersection. While the hotel rooms are a bit back from the road, the terrace apartments are directly on it. Even with double doors facing to that street, it was very, very loud, especially at night when you are trying to sleep. Roaring semi trucks and motorcycles, some shaking the windows. Thank goodness we got in late most nights or were very tired - I wore ear plugs also though. It didn't bother my boyfriend but I would never stay there again because it was so loud. It makes me sad because I thought the staff was very lovely and friendly, there was internet included, the lobby bar was quaint and nice, the rate was pretty good for expensive Sydney, etc. But if you want a good night's (quiet) sleep, the Hughenden will need to put in some thicker windows to have me back. As for the hotel rooms, they definitely look a lot shabbier and eclectic from reviewer photos than the terrace apartments do. If you can, check out the apts first, if the rate suits you.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Elise5-5
Reviews.Content: Quite shabby and dirty, furniture looked straight out of a cheap charity shop. Cockroaches scurrying at night - a couple of dead ones in the light fitting. Broadband internet didn't happen but staff insinuated it was my fault. Too many cars for the parking facilities on some nights so I didn't my paid-for spot. Phone messages were not conveyed to me although I expressly asked each time I reentered the hotel. This caused further problems after I left this hotel. The staff were quite pleasant, seemed to show concern but actually couldn't care two hoots about customer service. The breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good value & location, needs improvement though”
Reviews.Author: Gringravitas
Reviews.Content: This is an interesting hotel. It is certainly very old and quaint in a certain kind of way. We stayed in a cozy room and it really was. The room was not much bigger than the double bed we slept on, with a small ensuite and and the tiny TV on a set of drawers. Nice high ceilings meant the room was relatively cool, but we got one with AC anyway. We had a fair bit of noise from people walking down the corridor of our room at night, but we did have the window open to avoid using the AC as much as possible. My biggest gripe was that the room really needed upgrading/maintenance. There was dado rail falling off the wall, the drawers handle had fallen off and had been reattached dodgily with a nail and the bathroom tiles were grubby with built up soap stain. I should note though that the bed and sheets were very clean, which is probably the most important thing for me. But as far as Im concerned, these little simple to fix things that make a hotel. All it needs is some remediation work and it would be really nice. To end on a good note, the restaurant & breakfast included was great! The staff were helpful too and one waitress in the restaurant in particular was amazingly friendly and helpful. I wish I could remember her name, but Im sure if you get to meet her in the restaurant you will know right away! Just remember that you are staying right near Oxford St in Sydney and that the price you are paying for a cozy room is pretty cheap, especially with included breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Penny120
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 twin rooms for a weekend in Sydney with interstate guests. It was so dirty, run-down and unmwelcoming we didn't even end up checking in. They also had no record of the 2 carparks we had booked despite rpeated emails confirming these. Spent the night in the city in a 5 star anonymous hotel. Why can't Sydney have a small. boutique hotel like Melbourne's? The Hughenden is in such a fabulous location but is not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Pokey and noisy”
Reviews.Author: RocketSydney
Reviews.Content: I had been recommended the hotel from a work colleague. I upgraded from a 'cosy' room to a Victoria roombecause I was told it was very 'tight' in the cosy room. However on arrival I took one look at the room and thought they had made a mistake and given me a 'cosy' instead. The receptionist said it was a Victoria room. The only difference between the two was the bigger bed in the Victoria. However the room is the same!!.. say what?? I told them I didnt upgrade for a bigger bed but bigger room. I was given a $50 reduction..'cosy' room price so remember to haggle. Also get a room upstairs as the staff are loud at times walking past your room. Breakfast is good however with good service.

Reviews.Title: “What happened to the this wonderful heritage hotel”
Reviews.Author: roslen1234
Reviews.Content: Have stayed many times. Staff remains pleasant. The rooms are tired and seem dirty and lots of things don't work. the restaurant has been refreshed but lacks the quirky and loveable artifacts of yesteryear. Parking dreadful, Shall come again to a coffee but not stay .

Reviews.Title: “great location room below par”
Reviews.Author: london1970
Reviews.Content: We had 1 night in the Hotel, but room needed upgrading and were of lack of maintenance. OK just to sleep. Breakfast was great. Location is great.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: samsonSydney
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the Terrace with our pet. Staff were great, great location. Would return

Reviews.Title: “Simply Average”
Reviews.Author: Sito_Journey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at in a terrace room in the hotel which I believe is the new wing of the hotel located across the road from the main building. The room was new but very simple and for the price per night it was average. For the same price we have found hotels with better services and rooms in Sydney. The terrace wing is on busy Oxford street and you can definitely hear the traffic noise for most of the day. The main building does have charm and the staff did seem helpful but the overall feeling we had was that if you are exploring Sydney then there are better hotels for that price in other areas. If you though like to stay close to the village atmosphere of the suburb of Woollahra, the cafes and local fashion stores of Oxford street, the magnificent Centenial Park and the Sydney Football and Cricket stadiums then the location of this hotel is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Check your booking prior to arrival if on a long weekend!”
Reviews.Author: CRLong
Reviews.Content: Booked for Easter Saturday well ahead on the net for a Dinner/Bed and Breakfast package for my wife's birthday. Last stayed in 2005 as a solo and been promising to take my wife there. Rang before the weekend this time. All ok. Got a call back to advise the Dining Room is closed on Easter Saturday night-breakfast only the whole weekend! An offer of a vouvher for dinner at at later time or a light snack was offerred. We accepted the voucher as luckily we live in Sydney and can return at some time in the future, however, it lost the whole impact of a dinner/bed and breakfast package! The rooms are well due for a refurb and broken glass China Cabinet in hall way could is dangerous.

Reviews.Title: “How times change”
Reviews.Author: twocando
Reviews.Content: It is 2 years since I stayed on a business trip and I thought a holiday would be great because the Hughenden is very central. Unfortunately location is about all it has got going for it now. I remembered the service and ambience from my previous trip but unfortunately things must have changed. The bathroom was not cleaned properly and there was a dead cockroach in the wardrobe. The staff were friendly enough but seemed too busy to want to know about problems. For what it cost I will do better elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: MelBilly
Reviews.Content: When my aunt recommended The Hughendon, I didn't know what to expect. Sure, she said it had a "certain charm", but "charm" can mean a lot of things - expensive, run-down, unairconditioned. I knew the Hughendon was in a good area, so I decided to give it and its "charm" a go. Boy, am I glad I did! It was easy to get to, and close to *everywhere*. It was close to bus stops to the city and Bondi Beach, and my girlfriend really appreciated being a few minutes' walk from Paddington's Oxford St fashion strip. I'm gunna be honest, my girlfriend and I are uni students, so we went up on a shoe-string budget, and the room was very affordable, meaning my girlfriend had more of our budget to spend on clothes :P It has it's own restaurant - perfect for candlelit dinners and hungover brekkies. The room was clean, and the staff were really approachable, friendly, and *HELPFUL*. They knew the city and the area inside-out, and their advice was spot-on :) There's really only one word for it - charming.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: cxb63
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with traveller123468 and I think we ended up in the same room as traveller123468. However, on reflection I would probably stay at Faulty Towers. The smell in our room was so bad, that even the girl at the front counter came to our room about 2 mins after we walked into it, said to us, "I think you will need this" and handed my partner a can of air freshener. The room absolutely stank. Even leaving the window open for the entire afternoon did not help get rid of the smell. In fact I think it was worse when we returned. However, we had done our homework whilst we were in the city in the afternoon and found another hotel. A 5 star hotel opposite Hyde Park for an extra $30.00 per night and we were on the 19th floor with a beautiful view of Hyde Park. Pure luxury!!! Wouldn't recommend The Hughenden to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional”
Reviews.Author: Tomas_8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Hughenden over many years, often with various family members (making a crowd). It has always been excellent. We like the sense of it being the same from year to year, cosy, slightly, ever so slightly shabby, just like a welcoming home. Noel Coward and the 1920's set would have fit right in.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Filthy.. Worse than Faulty Towers”
Reviews.Author: traveller123468
Reviews.Content: The place looks nothing like the pictures on the internet. The room I stayed in was cold and filthy. Paid $240 p/n for a "deluxe king room", which was foul, strange smell and filthy bed cover, not to mention the mold growing in the bathroom. All the staff I encountered were incompetent and bordering rude. This place makes Faulty Towers look like the Ritz. Either the people writing the good reviews on this site were visiting from their home in a trailer park or the owners are logging on trying to boost the rating of this dive.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely!”
Reviews.Author: soph307
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped into the Hughenden Boutique Hotel, we adored it! It really is a charming hotel with cozy fireplaces, the sounds of beautiful piano melodies and interesting antiques displayed all around. The staff were friendly and helpful, the service was great and the meals at the restaurant, Quaifes were lovely! Definitely good value for money, especially considering the fantastic location â€“ superb for shopping or cafÃ© hopping, and only a 10 minute bus ride into town, Bondi Junction or Bondi Beach! Canâ€™t wait for our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms not very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: littlebear86
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over new years and found the location great. The service was ok but the rooms were teeny tiny and and very uncomfortable. The restaurant was great but I would not stay there again - the location is perfect but it is not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Close to all the action without all the unpleasant Sydney noise”
Reviews.Author: sazalla
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Sydney before so were unsure of where would be a good location or place to stay. We came across this small hotel which looked unique and interesting and a bit more warm and cosy than those sterile large hotels. It was perfect! Located so convinenantly near everything that we wanted to see - 15 mins from city, 15 mins from Bondi beach, 5 mins from Bondi Junction, 20 mins from Circular Quay, and right on the bus route too. The rooms were very comfortable and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The meals were delicious and breakfast was included too! We even spotted a few famous faces while dining (apparently Woollahra/Paddington area in Sydney is known to be a hot spot). We will definately be returning to Sydney and to the Hughenden. We are even going to buy a gift voucher for our parents to stay. And we saw they have high tea in winter which looks great too!

Reviews.Title: “left a bad taste in my mouth”
Reviews.Content: I pre booked a family "apartment" in November 2008 for our stay in march 2009. I especially mentioned that i had a three month old baby, a five year old child , my husband and his mother as well as myself- that we were looking for a two bedroom apartment with a lounge - all was confirmed- price, cot, bath and shower. On arrival (after travelling 24 hours) we arrive to a SHOCKER of a "room" with no bath- I immediately go to reception and mention that this is not the "apartment" that we had booked as there was no bath - they told me that they have "no such rooms" as what i was quoted for ie 2 bedroom and lounge and bath - also I was told that they dont do cots- I have in writing a confirmation of a cot, eventually they say "ok we will do a cot" Theyu put us in two separate rooms accross the road (apparently newly built) this defeated the objeadt of having my mother in law with us to help out as she was noe in another room--- uptairs. our room was so tiny that the pram had to stay outside. The ceiling creaked as if it was about to fall on us, the back door thudded all night long. No soap in the bath room- I called reception to ask- very junior receptionist said she will try make a plan...... We were told that they could do us a special favour as they messed up- and the favour was? - stay in two separate rooms next to each other and pay double what we were originally quoted. We called meriton apartments in bondi jusction as they were SUPERB , helpful, friendly and we got exactely what we wanted a 2 bedroom apartment with all amenities at the same price!!!!. On check out the rude and awful manageress, Lisa was very stand offish and unapologetic- they wasted 24 hours of our holiday- with infants and children there is no excuse.

Reviews.Title: “Too quaint for me”
Reviews.Author: rojaan1
Reviews.Content: This "boutique" hotel is too quaint for me. I like clean modern amenities. This hotel has none of those. The rooms need a good clean and a paint. The furniture is not antique just old and shabby. I stayed in two rooms during my one week stay. The first room was very small, with a very small cupboard that would only hold a shirt or skirt, no dresses. There was only enough room to walk around the bed. The TV reception was appaling, maybe because the TV was a 10" palsonic ~! Lucky I only has one case. The second room had a sitting room with a very lumpy daybed, but it did have a modern plasma TV. Tea/coffee facilities in both rooms were hit and miss. On arrival there was a cup sitting on the bath - it stayed there for 4 days ! The bathroom needed more than a good clean - see photo !! Breakfast was included. Checkout was a nightmare - it took over half an hour and two staff to finally get the account right. IMO this place needs a major overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic”
Reviews.Author: pablomelb23
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the Australia day longweekend and found the Hotel to be just satisfactory . The bath room was impossibly small (you had to put your head in the wash basin to use the toilet) and a little grubby . On one day we had no towels and had to dress and ask at the desk as reception did not answer the phone . The iron in the room leaked and did not heat up . Frustrating when you are preparing to go out. The advertised Australia day "gourmet breakfast "turned out to be watery ham frozen hard boiled eggs white toast and weak coffee . The decor is very old and faded (not antique ,rather 1930,s depression period) and the whole place is in need of a face lift and restaffing with trained hospitality staff. The price we payed $228 is just not justified by the level of comfort ,ammenity and service offered

Reviews.Title: “absolutely lovely!”
Reviews.Author: OscarCassy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hughenden Boutique Hotel for the first time last month, and absolutely loved it! I stayed in the Gatehouse apartment - I got a free upgrade when I checked in, so it was fabulous value. I ate breakfast every morning at the cafe/restaurant (I think it was called Quaife's) and the staff were super helpful, catering for my special diet. A healthy gluten free breakfast can be hard to find! Next time I am in Sydney I plan on trying out the Hughenden Paddington Terraces, and will add another comment on this site so you know whether its worth while. Looks good online though! Over and out!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, Friendly, Fun”
Reviews.Author: domestictraveller
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a week with my boyfriend. We were just down visiting family in Sydney, and we found the location to be so easy and convinent (near transport, nice area, etc). The rooms were cosy and warm, and it felt homely. The restaurant had beautiful food and service, and it was relaly lovely with the pianist and fire place going. Overall I found it good value for money in comparison to prices of other hotels in that area. We have already booked our retun at Christmas!

Reviews.Title: “Faded glory”
Reviews.Author: LJWNYC2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several days during our honeymoon. The staff at the desk was perfectly nice, but the place was really run-down for the prices we were paying. I understand it's supposed to be old and charming and homey, but mostly it looked old and grubby. There is no excuse for stained pillows everywhere, stained chairs, stained rugs, lack of vacuuming, 3 posters only on what is supposed to be a 4 poster bed... And the cleaning staff definitely did the bare miniumum. We had to ask for new towels, even when we made it clear we needed new ones, and had to clean up the room ourselves every day (similar to a previous reviewer's beer can situation). It was very disappointing as I expected a much nicer place for the money, esp as it's not super close to where we spent much of our time (in the more touristy areas). I think the place needs a makeover badly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: albany1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hughenden last thursday and friday night. We booked a two room family suite as we have a seven month old baby. There is secure off street car parking. The room has alot of charm associated with the building's grand Victorian heritage. The hotel has spacious public areas including the restaurant, bar, reading room and outdoor alfresco areas. We felt comfortable staying around after breakfast and reading the complimentary newspapers without being moved on by the restaurant staff. We had dinner on the thursday night and the food was fantastic. The hotel is also situated a short walk from centennial park and shops/cafes. We would recommend the Hughenden for anyone looking for somewhere central and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Pet Friendly Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: CentralCoastCleo
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at the Hughenden Boutique Hotel and loved everything! The place is gorgeous, charming and I felt like I was at home. The best part is the pet friendly accommodation. I had a room with private outside courtyard, and it was lovely to sit out there with Cleo - my puppy and have a few drinks! I was even able to dine in the restaurant with Cleo. She was provided with a cute chew bone and I was spoilt with fantastic fresh food and a lovely bottle of the wine. If you need to get away for a just a few days and want to relax - then I would recommend going to the Hughenden. The staff are welcoming, happy, and always more than happy to help - I really felt at home.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Glamanda
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in large 5 star hotels when I travel and this place is still one of my favourites because it is so different! This boutique hotel has loads of character and charm and the location is absolutely perfect, close to fantastic shopping, on a lovely tree lined street. It's also really close to the Sydney CBD and Bondi Beach (ideal for tourists) The restaurant is also excellent - the food is always tasty and the service is good! I highly recommend this for people who want to stay in a unique boutique-style hotel (rather than a large chain hotel) for more personalised service, in a wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Angel_Paddington
Reviews.Content: The Hughenden Boutique Hotel is not only a 'home away from home' but, for me, it was a 'home between homes'! I stayed here while I was moving from one address to another.....and I keep coming back for dinner, as a local! Stepping into the Hughenden is like stepping back into an era of elegance and true Aussie hospitality, hard to find in today's hustle and bustle. Acquaint yourself, as I have, with the hotel's friendly staff, homely furnishings, the building's historical significance, artefacts and memorabilia, and walls boasting the creative works of local artists and authors. Delicious aromas waft from Quaiffe's Restaurant, and the melodic tunes from Sir Victor's baby grand piano accompany you through the Victorian lounge and up the stairs to cosy bedrooms that invite you to a good night's sleep,,,,,with the promise of a hearty breakfast in the morning. You won't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “I adore this place”
Reviews.Author: dcmwoman
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at this home away from home and it seems to just get better and better. The room wasn't huge but it was very comfortable. I've stayed at this hotel in other rooms that were a bit bigger but I can honestly say it didn't impact on my enjoyment. It's a quirky place that has a great warm heart. I found the staff lovely and the little restaurant is good value. I adored the breakfast and the fact that I can walk in Centennial Park or go window shopping down Oxford Street on my morning walk is fanstastic.

Reviews.Title: “Charmed by The Hughenden”
Reviews.Author: CourtneyHongKong
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from my first trip to Sydney. We stayed at the Hughenden. What an absolute pleasure. The Hughenden is truly a gem amongst hotels. A rambling old house, busting with character. The minute you walk in the door you start to relax. Such refreshing change from the faceless corporate hotels that seem to be taking over the world's holiday destinations. The staff were relaxed and unobtrusive, but professional and, without exception, incredibly warm and genuinely friendly. If you are looking for a hotel with charm and character, look no further. It's not modern, it's not huge. It's cosy, relaxing & endearingly eccentric - stacks of books, armchairs occupied by well loved teddy bears, glass fronted cabinets with stacks of old china, traditional wooden rocking horse, piano. The Hughenden is located on a charming tree-lined street filled with art galleries, antique shops, and quaint little specialist shops. Smartly dressed elderly ladies drift up & down with their pedigree dogs. The beautiful "Centennial Park" is just across the road (largest park in Australia) and you are equi-distant from Bondi beach & Sydney harbour. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “No better place to stay at Christmas. Such friendly people.”
Reviews.Author: DanceTango
Reviews.Content: I was delighted on my arrival on The Hughenden on 23rd Dec 2007. The staff were very helpful having arrived at 7am. Though our room was not ready another room was offered to freshen up in with a cuppa tea or coffee in the Victorian Lounge. "Sir Victor" as he is known was tinkling on the grand piano. So sad we had eaten on the plane because the English breakfast was delicious but too much to eat. Loved the Reading Room, the corridors full of artifacts, the "moon/sun" deck and arty-antique feel. A real part of Australian English heritage! Room ready, bags unpacked and just like home not quite enough wardrobe space! Great location with buses at the door to the city or Bondi Beach. Oxford St and Queen St - a Saturday stay is a must with Paddington Markets just around the corner. We indulged in a dinner at the restaurant - thought the selection was not big the quality and atmosphere was delightful We are coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but excellent”
Reviews.Author: Polemic
Reviews.Content: Yes the rooms are small... and the bathrooms smaller. The rooms I've stayed in have had a small wardrobe but I found it easier to simply live out of the suitcase, which slides easily under the bed. You wouldn't want to spend much time in a room as small as most of the Hughenden's seem to be, but then that's not why you come to Sydney. And if you want to hang round the hotel there's the lounge (sometimes complete with piano player), the reading room (with an eclectic a mix of books as I've ever seen anywhere), or the outdoor mezzanine area. The beds are perhaps the best thing about this quaint and charming place. They're firm, comfortable, and a delight to sleep in. The staff are harried at times - I heard the girl who seemed to be in charge of breakfast mention that she'd been the night porter the previous night!! But they brought in two delightful girls to help her and I didn't see anyone go without their breakfast. Breakfasts, by the way, are incredible - be careful what you ask for. I asked for "a little bit of everything" and received a plate so full I didn't need to eat till dinner! Great value considering breakfast was included in the very reasonable tariff. Overall the cleanliness was good. I left a pizza box outside the door late at night because I didn't want the smell in the room and it was gone early the next morning. The room was always well serviced and spotless except in those "hard to reach" places like the fan blades on the high ceilings which clearly hadn't been wiped down in a while... quite how they'd managed when the bed occupies 90% of the floor space and you'd need a 2 metre ladder to get up there, I'm not sure! They also made an error in my bill but I picked it up when checking out and they corrected it quickly and cheerfully. The owners perhaps need to care about their staff more and their friends a little less (there seemed to be an 'elite' set of guests known personally to the owners, then 'the rest') but if you're sick to death of chipboard furniture, bland rooms, tasteless decor and tasteless food, then the Hughenden is great. Haven't seen the larger rooms, so can't comment as to whether it's any good for more than a single traveller. And my one complaint isn't with the hotel, it's with some of the guests... it isn't a multi-storey building with lots of "public" areas where you can create noise without disturbing other guests. So to sit in the outdoor area outside someone's window at 3.30am discussing your domestic problems at the top of your voice is inconsiderate. Testament to the Hughenden's popularity is that I had to delay my trip by a week to wait till a room was available and then, when business took longer than expected, I couldn't stay the extra 4 days because it was fully booked again. That's an occupancy rate that 5 star hotels would kill for.

Reviews.Title: “Think of it as a large B&B and you can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: julieanne
Reviews.Content: The best way to view the Hughenden is to think of it as a large bed and breakfast. It has a welcoming, warm atmosphere that definitely veers towards the artistic and antiquey. The breakfasts are huge (think eggs, bacon, fruit, yogurt, danishes, coffee, tea). The newspapers are free. And the beds are ultra-firm (a shame as you don't want to leave them to get the more than filling breakfasts!) I stayed here 8 years ago, and my husband and I happily returned last week. It is true, there are a few tiny rooms, and I made sure to book the Victorian Suite this time. Bathroom was large: roll top bath, massive shower and lovely Victorian details. The bedroom was spacious too...though TV was very small. I found the service to be very good happy to book taxis for us, happy to welcome us in at midnight when we arrived from London and happy to suggest local venues. The weekend we were there, they were hosting an Organic festival: the owners are very involved with local art scene. It is a 35 minute walk into center of Sydney and the local area is just gorgeous (packed with boutiques, chic restaurants and the splendid Centennial Park). Think B&B and you'll love it! Think Hilton, you'll be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel. Rooms small, noisy and have limited technology that often does not work properly. Hotel staff rude and unhelpful. Try the Manor House in Paddington, much better although costs a bit more, similar location.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel really is a mix of the very good and the very bad. I arrived straight from the airport at around 6.30am and was met with a warm welcome. I was told that they had a nice room available which I could go in to straight away. The room was quite large and offered a balcony. The breakfasts are fantastic and offer a very good range and variety. The decor is very diferent from most corporate chains and has been decorated with interesting antiques and art work. Thisd hotel certainly has its fans and some will find this rather charming- I personally felt the hotel was more of a large B&B (in need of further renovation) than a 4 star hotel (as advertised by the 'hotel'). Cleaning at this hotel is also a little hit and miss. My room was not supplied with a bin. I drank a couple of bottles pf beer on the balcony one evening and left the empties to be cleaned away- they remained however where I had left them throughout my stay and they didnt appear to take the hint. Service is the largest area of concern in this hotel as the staff here can be really quite rude, surly and unhelpful. On chequing out, there was a confusion over payment and they made me feel as if I was trying to rob the place and tried to make me investigate the matter myself using my mobile. The fiasco took about an hour to resolve during which time I grew to feel quite sorry for the guy working on the front desk as he couldnt handle all the incoming calls and had to hang up on at least ten people- I would have probably been less than impressed if I had been at the other end. Service at breakfast was similarly chaotic- I would wait for 20 minutes or so to be asked whether I would like the cooked breakfast (which I had already paid for) and then was forced to approach the waitress myself and ask if I could possibly have something to eat- her reply was less than apologetic and rather more distainful. I found the location of this hotel a little inconvenient as the bus journey took about 20 minutes to the city centre. I enquired about other forms of transport and was told that there might be a train but they didnt know exactly where the station was. I wouldnt stay at this hotel but it is entirely possible that other guests may encounter an entirely diferent experience (such is the variable nature of this place).

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: maxndave
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband were booked to stay in the hotel over the New Year period 2004/5. On checking-in we were asked to pay for the room in advance (although we had not yet been shown the room), and so paid the invoice in full. When we finally entered the room we were gutted! The room was way too small for a double bed, there were no wardrobes and so we had to live out of our suitcases, no storage space for suitcases and so had to jump over them, the drains in the bathroom smelt really bad, as well as the bathroom door not being able to open fully without hitting the bed! On top of this, the room was not clean. When we looked behind the curtains, there were cobwebs on the windows, dead insects behind the bed, and the decoration was shabby. When we tried to get a full refund, we were told that we were only entitled to 50% of the money back, and should they be able to re-rent the room, we would get another 20% back - neddless to say we didnt get the further 20% refunded. However, we did decide to leave and checked in to the Holiday Inn in the Rocks, Syd - AMAZING view for the NYE fireworks and a tad expensive, but worth it if your only going to visit Sydney the once.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: EJP_5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in August 04. We requested the Retreat about 6 months before we left and were given confirmation. The Retreat is 3 interconnecting rooms as we are a large family, I also emailed some time before we left to check these rooms were the ones booked, however on arrival we were given different room as the Retreat had been given to one of the owners friends. This did cause some inconvenience as we had to climb over a sofa bed in the night to get to the bathroom as the rooms we were given weren't set up for the extra bed. The desk staff were apologetic and tried their best to help us in the circumstances. The breakfast was excellent. The rooms we had weren't as clean as I would expect, but price was reasonable. Overall not bad but do check that the room you are booking is the one you get as I did get a feeling that this wasn't the first time that pre-booked rooms had been given to someone else.

HotelInfo.Name: Hughenden Boutique Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 14 Queen St, Sydney, New South Wales 2025, Australia
